meanings.sent1: During the rainstorm, the streets flooded quickly.
meanings.sent2: I always carry an umbrella during a rainstorm.
meanings.sent3: The rainstorm caught me off guard, leaving me drenched.
meanings.sent4: The rainstorm was like a waterfall pouring from the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the rainstorm was deafening, echoing through the town.
meanings.sent6: After the rainstorm, the air felt fresh and clean.
meanings.sent7: The rainstorm brought much-needed water to the dry fields.
meanings.sent8: We canceled our picnic due to the approaching rainstorm.
meanings.sent9: The rainstorm passed quickly, leaving behind puddles on the ground.
meanings.sent10: The rainstorm caused a delay in the outdoor concert.

meanings.definition: To be the victim of a rainstorm.
meanings.sent1: I hope I don't rainstorm during our camping trip.
meanings.sent2: She rainstormed while waiting for the bus.
meanings.sent3: He always seems to rainstorm when he forgets his umbrella.
meanings.sent4: They rainstormed on their way home from school.
meanings.sent5: The poor cat rainstormed outside in the storm.
meanings.sent6: Don't rainstorm on me when I'm already wet!
meanings.sent7: I rainstormed yesterday and had to change my clothes.
meanings.sent8: If you rainstorm, just come inside and dry off.
meanings.sent9: She rainstormed on her way to the store and got soaked.
meanings.sent10: We all rainstormed during the sudden downpour.
